#summary Installation for Debian / Ubuntu

The delaboratory.deb files are created and maintained by Dariusz Duma and can be found at https://launchpad.net/~dhor/+archive/myway

= Installation =

= Ubuntu / Mint based on Ubuntu =

== with installer ==

Just use your graphic installer like synaptic:
  * add to your sources: ppa:dhor/myway
  * update 
  * install delaboratory

== on terminal ==

`sudo add-apt-repository ppa:dhor/myway`

`sudo apt-get update`

`sudo apt-get install delaboratory`

=Debian / Debian based distro's =

* Dreamlinux. Mint based on Debian, LMDE, etc, *

Add to /etc/apt/sources.list using an editor like f.i nano

`deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/dhor/myway/ubuntu lucid main` 

`deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/dhor/myway/ubuntu lucid main`

sudo or su 

`apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 93330B78`

`apt-get update`

`apt-get install delaboratory`

= Aptosid =

add to /etc/apt/sources.list.d/debian.list 

`deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/dhor/myway/ubuntu maverick main` 

`deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/dhor/myway/ubuntu maverick main`

su 

`apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 93330B78`

`apt-get update`
`apt-get install delaboratory`
`Ctrl D or exit`
